medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe growth failure in a young female subject.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with severe growth failure at 16.4 years of age, with a height of 114 cm. She was first referred to an endocrine center at 7.8 years of age when her height was 94 cm (below the third percentile). Growth was significantly retarded, and she remained below expected growth curve parameters despite being treated with recombinant GH for 3 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of mild thrombocytopenia with a negative platelet aggregation test; a previous episode of epistaxis at 8 months of age.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are second cousins with paternal and maternal heights of 169 cm and 160 cm, respectively. Two brothers showed normal serum levels.
